About Pear

What is Pear

Pear is a social networking application that lets you meet potential partners. We collect information from users and use it to pear them in an optimal way.

We don't just ask who you like and who you don't like, we find out who you like more and who likes you more. We do so by asking you to compare, in each case, two users of the opposite sex and select your preferred one among them. Of course, we don’t share this information, so “Bob” will never know he is “Ann’s” last choice!

Matches are found using a Nobel Prize winning algorithm, developed by mathematicians David Gale and Lloyd Shapley --- published in a work that they titled, we kid you not, "The Stability of Marriage". To date, the work of Gale and Shapley is the main quantitative tool that social scientists use to study who marries/dates/etc. whom in modern societies.

If you are tired of apps that match you with dozens of people who aren't really interested in you, that never write you back, for whom you are not a priority, then pear is for you. We only create matches that matter, and a limited number of them at each point in time. The more you use the app, the more our software learns your preferences, thereby increasing the quality and value of your matches.

1. Create an account
2. Create your profile
3. Start comparing
4. Explore profiles
5. See your comparisons
6. Chat and pear up

The pear report

Besides helping you making new friends, we want to improve your knowledge about what you like and what others think about you. Periodically, we will provide you with an individual report that will inform you of your own tastes i.e. do you consistently rank doctors higher than lawyers as potential mates? Is age really showing up in your preferences? Stuff like that. We will also provide you with how you score with people of the opposite sex, i.e. what profiles tend to like you more? And so on - we hope you will enjoy it!

Pear is free. However, a premium version of the individual report will be made available to paying users only. We value your use of our product. But we will value you even more if you support us buying premium membership!

Why pear

Online dating has been growing steadily in popularity. Roughly, about 1 in 5 relationships now start online in the UK and US.

Despite its popularity, or maybe because of it, online dating currently suffers from a congestion problem. Women tend to receive a large number of messages from male users. Often, they are unable to distinguish real interest from spam. The problem is not just present when unsolicited messages are possible (e.g. in OK Cupid or POF), Tinder and the likes of it, where matched users must have expressed a reciprocal interest, are not immune. It’s a fact that on Tinder, men like a very high-percentage of women. Often, this appreciation is not backed by strong interest. This dilutes the quality of the signal women receive from a match.

Pear solves the congestion problem by using the information users provide to offer high-quality matches. When we match you with someone, you know that, in a certain sense, you are meant for each other. More precisely, there’s no other user that you rank higher than your current match that would give up any of their current matches to be matched with you (please read our blog post for more details). The algorithm we use isn’t just a beautiful mathematical idea. Research into the topic suggests it fares extremely well in predicting real life dating and marriage patterns (we refer you to another blog post of ours for more details).
